meanings.definition: The soft, fatty substance in the cavities of bones, especially the long bones.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that bone marrow helps make blood cells.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed a warm bowl of soup with rich marrow from the bones.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the secret to his delicious stew was a touch of bone marrow.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, reaching the very marrow of our bones.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bone marrow under the microscope was fascinating.

meanings.definition: The choicest or most essential part.
meanings.sent1: In her speech, she touched the marrow of the issue, addressing the core problem.
meanings.sent2: The artist captured the marrow of the landscape in his breathtaking painting.
meanings.sent3: His joke hit the marrow of truth, making everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song resonated deep within, reaching the marrow of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The quote struck a chord with its profound marrow of wisdom.
